description: The length of time a customer has been with the company, older accounts may be less likely to churn
The average monthly usage of the customer, higher usage may indicate lower likelihood of churn
The number of interactions a customer has with customer support, more interactions may indicate dissatisfaction and higher likelihood of churn
The type of contract the customer has, such as month-to-month, one year, or two years, with month-to-month customers having a higher likelihood of churn
The payment method used by the customer, different payment methods may have different churn rates
The speed of the customer's internet connection, with higher speeds potentially correlating with lower churn rates
The number of additional services or subscriptions the customer has, with more subscriptions potentially leading to lower churn
The rating the customer has given to the company's service, with lower ratings indicating higher likelihood of churn
The extent to which the customer uses promotional offers, with more use potentially indicating higher likelihood of churn
The average monthly bill amount for the customer, with higher bills potentially correlating with lower likelihood of churn
